roleset.name: to fail or end weakly

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Crude prices spurted upward in brisk trading on the assumption that heavy earthquake damage occurred to San Francisco area refinery complexes , but the rise quickly fizzled when it [*EXP*-1] became apparent that oil operations were n't severely curtailed [*-2][*T*-3] .
example.arg: when it [*EXP*-1] became apparent that oil operations were n't severely curtailed

roleset.note: FIZZLE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fizzle' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from fizzle.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: to fail or end weakly, phrasal

example.name: fizzle_out-v
example.text: That was followed by Hurricane Ophelia , a category one storm , which last week touched the North Carolina coast , on the eastern US seaboard , causing some property damage and localized flooding before *PRO* fizzling out at sea .

roleset.note: FIZZLE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fizzle' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from fizzle.01-v predicate notes)
